qas.question: What was the name of Madonna's tenth studio album?
When was Confessions on a Dance Floor released?
Which award the the album win?
Which pop group allowed Madonna to sing a cover of their song Gimme! Gimme! Gimme!
What was the name of the single that was Madonna's twelfth number one hit in the UK?

context: Her tenth studio album, <a0_0>Confessions on a Dance Floor<a0_0/>, was released in <a1_0>November 2005<a1_0/>. Musically the album was structured like a club set composed by a DJ. It was acclaimed by critics, with Keith Caulfield from Billboard commenting that the album was a "welcome return to form for the Queen of Pop." The album won a <a2_0>Grammy Award<a2_0/> for Best Electronic/Dance Album. Confessions on a Dance Floor and its lead single, "Hung Up", went on to reach number one in 40 and 41 countries respectively, earning a place in Guinness World Records. The song contained a sample of <a3_0>ABBA<a3_0/>'s "Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight)", only the second time that ABBA has allowed their work to be used. ABBA songwriter Björn Ulvaeus remarked "It is a wonderful track—100 per cent solid pop music." "<a4_0>Sorry<a4_0/>", the second single, became Madonna's twelfth number-one single in the UK.
